{"step_by_step_thinking": "Pregnancy-induced hypertension is a condition characterized by high blood pressure during pregnancy. It can lead to various complications. Pre-eclampsia and HELLP syndrome are both well-known complications of pregnancy-induced hypertension. Renal failure can also occur as a result of the condition. Fetal macrosomia, on the other hand, is not typically associated with pregnancy-induced hypertension. Therefore, the least likely complication of pregnancy-induced hypertension is fetal macrosomia.", "answer_choice": "D"}
